author: jimmygchen
content:
We've found a few things from this round of testing:
- unable to sync from grandine (see LH <> Grandine thread)
- the syncing LH node got insta banned by peers after building a block while syncing that would revert finalization - we've created a github issue for this

I think neither of these are peerdas related. Will continue with testing other scenarios.

Looks like we're progressing well with most clients though, and closer to peerdas-devnet-4!

author: dapplion
content: <@&595683609080365088> LH sent Prysm a block that would revert finality, and it was inserted into the bad blocks cache. Then we sent a child block with it's 128 columns all of which triggered downscoring events so we got banned by good. How long it takes Prysm to un-ban us?

author: nishant0
content: It would take a long time

author: nishant0
content: Probably better if you just restart prysm so that is wipes its memory on all the peer scores
